alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 22 at 6:10PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT FOR THE CENTRAL DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA...WEST CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGES... SOUTHEASTERN ARLINGTON...AND SOUTHEASTERN FAIRFAX COUNTIES AND THE CITY OF ALEXANDRIA... At 609 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Reagan National Airport, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Measured wind gust of 59 mph at DCA. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Arlington, Alexandria, Clinton, Fort Washington, Groveton, Forestville, Huntington, Largo, Coral Hills, National Harbor, Reagan National Airport, Rosslyn, Crystal City, RFK Stadium, Nationals Park, Gallaudet University, Andrews Air Force Base, Howard University, Camp Springs and Oxon Hill. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
